update.description: fixes issue w/ copied entity's Z position and rotation not being honored on paste.
update.title: fixes mentor2 issue #62

content.raw:
Oh sorry for the confusing comment, I just mentioned default to explain that the problem is only on this branch.

To make the fix work with motors, batteries and switches, I think it would be enough to add something around line 1976, I'll comment there.
content.html:
Oh sorry for the confusing comment, I just mentioned default to explain that the problem is only on this branch.

To make the fix work with motors, batteries and switches, I think it would be enough to add something around line 1976, I'll comment there.

Add something like this here?

    // Propagate copied entity's Z position and rotation
    math::Pose copiedPose = copiedNestedModel->GetPose();
    clonePose.pos.z = copiedPose.pos.z;
    clonePose.rot = copiedPose.rot;

content.raw:
There are significant changes in ModelCreator::OnPaste() between the default and mentor2_v2 branches.   Do we want to bring those forward before trying to fix the pose/rotation issue?

I guess it's unclear what you'd like me to do.
content.html:
There are significant changes in ModelCreator::OnPaste() between the default and mentor2_v2 branches. Do we want to bring those forward before trying to fix the pose/rotation issue?

I guess it's unclear what you'd like me to do.

content.raw:
On the default branch, this is 

~~~
math::Pose clonePose = copiedLink->linkVisual->GetWorldPose();
~~~

I guess we messed it up when we added the nested model logic.

It's probably a good idea to add the fix which was done for links also for nested models, a few lines below. Otherwise copy/pasting things like motors and batteries will still have issue #62.
content.html:
On the default branch, this is 

math::Pose clonePose = copiedLink->linkVisual->GetWorldPose();

I guess we messed it up when we added the nested model logic.

It's probably a good idea to add the fix which was done for links also for nested models, a few lines below. Otherwise copy/pasting things like motors and batteries will still have issue #62.

content.raw: Sounds good. The pull request cannot be merged in its current state though, because mercurial is not able to resolve the conflicts on that file by itself. To do it manually, you must merge the target branch, OSRF's `mentor2_v2`, into your fork's version, fix the conflicts, and then commit a clean version. I like to use [meld](http://meldmerge.org) to resolve conflicts.
content.html: Sounds good. The pull request cannot be merged in its current state though, because mercurial is not able to resolve the conflicts on that file by itself. To do it manually, you must merge the target branch, OSRF's mentor2_v2, into your fork's version, fix the conflicts, and then commit a clean version. I like to use meld to resolve conflicts.

content.raw:
This is how the toolbar looks for me now. I'm using Ubuntu Unity

![copypaste.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3661123707-copypaste.png)

content.raw:
I wonder if it makes sense to have paste on a link's context menu, since the new link won't really be pasted right on top of it.

I realize this is how it works during simulation though, so I'm fine with leaving it as it is.
content.html:
I wonder if it makes sense to have paste on a link's context menu, since the new link won't really be pasted right on top of it.

I realize this is how it works during simulation though, so I'm fine with leaving it as it is.

content.raw: When I right-click a link inside the editor, the context menu shows up but the copy button is not enabled because the link is not selected. Maybe we should make it selected on right-click?
content.html: When I right-click a link inside the editor, the context menu shows up but the copy button is not enabled because the link is not selected. Maybe we should make it selected on right-click?

content.html: Can you fix the indentation please?

content.html: Sure, no problem but I'm going to wait until this pull request is vetted/accepted before making the changes to default

update.description: seemed like the model editor needs a little more obvious cut and paste ui so I added them to the model selection context menu and to an edit toolbar menu item.
update.title: adds copy/paste to model editor

content.raw: Great! Do we ever need to reset it to have an icon?
content.html: Great! Do we ever need to reset it to have an icon?

creating an empty icon on ubuntu did the trick:

QIcon icon;
g_copyAct->setIcon(icon);

content.raw: maybe a unity and osx thing? I know the icons appear in osx but I don't see them in classic (non-unity) ubuntu.
content.html: maybe a unity and osx thing? I know the icons appear in osx but I don't see them in classic (non-unity) ubuntu.

content.raw:
There's an issue for this #1070 and I think the reason why we hadn't done it yet was that the g_copy/paste actions have icons which show on the menu, unlike all other actions on the menu. I think it was @spaepcke who asked we keep everything consistent. I remember trying a bit to remove the icon just for the menu without success. 

I haven't built this branch yet but I suspect the icons are showing, right? Personally I'm ok with it having icons, I just felt like I should point this out.
content.html:
There's an issue for this #1070 and I think the reason why we hadn't done it yet was that the g_copy/paste actions have icons which show on the menu, unlike all other actions on the menu. I think it was @spaepcke who asked we keep everything consistent. I remember trying a bit to remove the icon just for the menu without success.

I haven't built this branch yet but I suspect the icons are showing, right? Personally I'm ok with it having icons, I just felt like I should point this out.
